intro: Lithocarpus amygdalifolius, commonly known as the almond-leaved stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a woody cupule, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, where it plays a role in maintaining ecosystem biodiversity.
